title: Understanding SQL Joins
text: In SQL, a JOIN clause is used to combine rows from two or more tables, based on a related column between them.

title: Types of Joins
text: There are several types of JOINs in SQL: INNER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, RIGHT JOIN, and FULL JOIN. Each type determines how the tables are combined.

title: Using ON Clause
text: The ON clause is used to specify the condition for the JOIN, usually by matching a column from each table.
